title: Texas Governor Calls For Probe of Atmos Energy in Wake of Freeze
description: Greg Abbott, governor of Texas, participates in the Pledge of Allegiance during a campaign event at the Heritage Ranch Golf Club House in Fairview, Texas, US, on Wednesday, Aug. 31, 2022. Abbott attended the Republican Club at Heritage Ranch monthly meeting to sign his Compact with Seniors plan.

title: Bolivian Police Arrest Opposition Governor, Sparking Protests
description: Bolivia’s police detained one of the country’s main opposition leaders, Santa Cruz Governor Luis Fernando Camacho, triggering protests by his supporters in the country’s wealthiest city.

title: Rep. Raskin, Key Figure in Trump Impeachment, Says He Has Lymphoma
description: Representative Jamie Raskin, who led President Donald Trump’s second impeachment for inciting the insurrection at the US Capitol, disclosed Wednesday he has a “serious but curable” form of cancer and will undergo chemotherapy.

title: Judge Cites Jan. 6 Committee to Reject Alleged Rioter’s Defense
description: Demonstrators swarm the U.S. Capitol building during a protest in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Wednesday, Jan. 6, 2021. The U.S. Capitol was placed under lockdown and Vice President Mike Pence left the floor of Congress as hundreds of Demonstrators swarmed past barricades surrounding the building where lawmakers were debating Joe Biden's victory in the Electoral College. Photographer: Eric Lee/Bloomberg

title: Nassau County DA Probes Santos’s ‘Stunning’ Fabrications
description: A New York Republican who flipped a Democratic-held congressional seat on Long Island is being investigated by a local prosecutor for telling “stunning” falsehoods about his education, work history and background.

title: Lockheed Challenges Textron’s $7 Billion Army Helicopter Win
description: US army AH-64 Apache attack helicopters fly over during the second annual "African Lion" military exercise in the Tan-Tan region in southwestern Morocco on June 30, 2022. (Photo by FADEL SENNA / AFP) (Photo by FADEL SENNA/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Chinese Women Found Their Voice in 2022. Is Anyone Listening?
description: Chinese women found a new voice to demand change in 2022. The government’s tentative response suggests tensions may only deepen in the coming year.

title: Kim Jong Un to Ring in New Year With Missiles and Nuclear Threats
description: Kim Jong Un in 2022 fired off missiles at a record pace, lowered the threshold for using nuclear weapons and thumbed his nose at global sanctions. He’s likely to turn up the heat even more in the coming year.

title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro Poised to Skip Lula’s Inauguration, Visit US Instead
description: Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva receives the presidential sash from Fernando Henrique Cardoso on January 1, 2003.

title: Italy to Test Travelers From China for Covid, Wants EU to Do Same
description: Travelers check in for a flight at the Hongqiao International Airport in Shanghai, China, on Monday, Dec. 12, 2022. Chinese officials continued to downplay the risks of Covid-19 as restrictions are eased, with a top medical adviser saying the fatality rate from the omicron variant of the virus is in line with influenza.

title: US to Require Negative Covid Tests for Travelers From China
description: The US will require airline passengers coming from China to show negative Covid-19 tests as global concerns ratchet higher over the virus’s spread since the country lifted its restrictions.

title: Paul Pelosi Attack Suspect Enters Not-Guilty Plea
description: San Francisco (AP) -- The man who allegedly broke into U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s home and beat her 82-year-old husband in October pleaded not guilty Wednesday to six charges, including attempted murder, prosecutors said.

title: Biden Border Woes Drag Into 2023 as Supreme Court Clouds Migrant Policy
description: President Joe Biden’s struggle to manage a historic influx of migrants will stretch into his third year in office, even after the Supreme Court kept in place pandemic-era border controls.

title: Banxico’s Esquivel Declines More Government Job Offers
description: Gerardo Esquivel

title: US Energy Regulator Opens Probe Into Winter Storm Blackouts
description: TOPSHOT - An excavator drives through Buffalo, New York, on December 27, 2022. - The monster storm that killed dozens in the United States over the Christmas weekend continued to inflict misery on New York state and air travelers nationwide Tuesday, as stories emerged of families trapped for days during the "blizzard of the century." (Photo by Joed Viera / AFP) (Photo by JOED VIERA/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Italy Reaches All 55 EU Recovery Fund Targets to Unlock Payments
description: Italy has successfully hit all 55 targets required to continue to receive European Union recovery fund cash, Minister Raffaele Fitto said in a statement.

title: Turkey, Syria Defense Chiefs Hold First Meeting Since Syrian Civil War Began
description: MOSCOW, RUSSIA - DECEMBER 28: Turkish Defence Minister Hulusi Akar (C) and Head of the Turkish Intelligence Organization, Hakan Fidan (R) arrive in Moscow, Russia ahead of their official visits on December 28, 2022. (Photo by Arif Akdogan/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images)

title: Israel Has Improved Readiness to Attack Iran, Minister Says
description: Israel has improved its readiness to attack Iran, Defense Minister Benny Gantz said on Wednesday, specifically citing preparations being made to hit nuclear sites.

title: Ferrexpo Owner Zhevago Detained in French Alps
description: Kostyantin Zhevago, the billionaire owner of Ukrainian iron producer Ferrexpo Plc, was detained in France on suspicion of money laundering and embezzling funds linked to his banking business at home, investigators in Kyiv said.

title: Germany Calls on Serbs to Take Down ‘Illegal’ Kosovo Barricades
description: Germany called on Serbs to dismantle “illegal” barricades on Kosovo’s border that expanded overnight to a key crossing after weeks of protests that have brought the region to the verge of a renewed conflict.

title: Somalia Declares Genel Oil Operations in Disputed Region Illegal
description: Somalia’s government declared Genel Energy Plc’s operations in a breakaway northern region illegal and said the company should cease claiming to hold rights for oil exploration and exploitation in the country.

title: Spain Sets Up Audit System Key to Unlocking EU Recovery Funds
description: Spain said a new audit system to track European Union funds is operational, a key milestone needed to unlock money from the bloc’s pandemic recovery fund and smooth relations with Brussels after implementation delays.

title: UK’s Sunak Braces for ‘Massive Disruption’ From Strikes
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s spokesman, Jamie Davies, told reporters the government acknowledges the strikes hitting the UK are causing “massive disruption.”

title: Biden’s Special Envoys Are About to Get Less Special
description: State Department special envoys are about to get less special.

title: Smotrich to Be Israel’s Finance Chief In Netanyahu-Led Cabinet
description: Bezalel Smotrich, the leader of the nationalist Religious Zionism party, is poised to become Israel’s next finance minister, under a bilateral agreement with Benjamin Netanyahu’s Likud party.

title: Vatican Says Health of Retired Pope Benedict XVI 'Worsening'
description: Vatican City (AP) -- The health of Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI has worsened due to his age, and doctors are constantly monitoring the 95-year-old’s condition, the Vatican said Wednesday.

title: Russian Billionaire Urges Africa to Press EU on Fertilizer Snarl
description: Russian fertilizer billionaire Andrey Melnichenko is lobbying politicians in Africa to pressure the European Union into finding a solution to the self-sanctioning he says is choking flows of food and vital crop nutrients.

title: Ukraine Latest: Zelenskiy Preparing for Davos, Speaks With Fink
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his government is preparing to participate in the World Economic Forum in Davos next month and that he spoke again with BlackRock Inc. Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink about the postwar rebuilding effort.

title: Indian Police Say 4 Suspected Rebels Killed in Kashmir After Gun Battle
description: New Delhi (AP) -- Police in Indian-controlled Kashmir said government forces killed four suspected militants in a gunbattle on Wednesday.

title: Trucker Gets 19 Years in Prison Over Role in Whitmer Kidnapping Plot
description: Grand Rapids, Mich. (AP) -- A Delaware trucker described as a co-leader of the conspiracy to kidnap Michigan’s governor was sentenced to more than 19 years in prison Wednesday, a day after an accomplice received 16 years behind bars.

title: South Korea Barely Mentions China in New Indo-Pacific Strategy
description: South Korea put out its first strategy report for the Indo-Pacific region, which hardly mentions China and signals Seoul is seeking a cautious balance between its biggest trade partner Beijing and main military ally, the US.

title: Philippine Transport Chief Favors Curbs for Chinese Visitors
description: Philippine Transport Secretary Jaime Bautista said he’s in favor of imposing Covid measures including testing on inbound travelers from China.

title: Johnson to Sunak via Truss: Britain’s Chaotic Year in Numbers
description: Revolving door in 10 Downing Street contributed to economic and political turmoil in 2022, handing the opposition Labour Party a huge poll lead.
